JOPF-DTV
Yamaguchi, Yamaguchi Prefecture
Japan
Branding KRY
Channels Digital: 20 (UHF)
Virtual: 4 (LCN)
Affiliations NNN/NNS
Owner Yamaguchi Broadcasting
Founded March 6, 1956
First air date October 1, 1959
Former channel number(s) Analog:
11 (VHF, 1959–2011)
Website kry.co.jp
JOPM-TV (defunct)
(Satellite of JOPF-TV)
Shimonoseki,Yamaguchi Prefecture
Japan
Channels Analog: 4 (VHF)
First air date September 30, 1964
Last air date July 24, 2011

Yamaguchi Broadcasting Co., Ltd. (山口放送 later named KRY) is a Japanese television and radio broadcasting company serving the city of Yamaguchi and Yamaguchi Prefecture. The initials come from K. K. Radio Yamaguchi.

  • 5 External links

Network[edit]

TV[edit]

  • Nippon News Network (NNN) and Nippon TV Network System (NNS)

RADIO[edit]

  • Japan Radio Network (JRN)
  • National Radio Network (NRN)

Supplement[edit]

  • Despite being a local station, it has five or more helicopters which are placed in its headquarters, the highest number for a local station.

Station list[edit]

Analog Television[edit]

  • Hagi 4ch
  • Iwakuni 11ch
  • Kanmon(Shimonoseki) JOPM-TV 4ch
  • Nagato 10ch
  • Shunan(Yamaguchi) JOPF-TV 11ch
  • Susa-Tamagawa 10ch etc...
  • Ube 61ch
  • Yamaguchi-Konomine 46ch

Digital Television(ID:4)[edit]

  • Iwakuni 39ch
  • Kanmon(Shimonoseki) JOPM-TV 4ch
  • Shunan(Yamaguchi) JOPF-DTV 20ch
  • Yamaguchi-Konomine 36ch

RADIO[edit]

  • Hagi JOPL 1485 kHz; 92.3 MHz FM
  • Iwakuni JOPN 918 kHz; 92.3 MHz FM
  • Shimonoseki JOPM 918 kHz; 92.3 MHz FM
  • Shunan JOPF 765 kHz; 92.3 MHz FM
  • Susatamagawa 765 kHz; 86.4 MHz FM
  • Yamaguchi JOPO 1458 kHz; 92.3 MHz FM

Program[edit]

TV[edit]

  • KRY Sawayaka Morning
  • Yukihiko Inoue Nekketu TV etc...
  • Yuuji Miyake DOSHIROUTO
  • One Piece

RADIO[edit]

  • HOT ZONE Ohayou KRY
  • Ohiru ha ZENKAI Radio na jikan
  • Swing Saturday etc...
